original: de kho na nyid kyi las kyi tshogs rnams grub par bya ba'i don du mchod pa dang / de yis dgug pa nges par brjod pa gang yin pa de le'u yang yin ba de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi las kyi tshogs rnams grub par bya ba'i don du mchod pa dang / de yis dgug pa nges par brjod pa gang yin pa de le'u yang yin ba de de bzhin no //
translated: The chapter is so called because it is the chapter in which the worship and the summoning of the yoginis is taught for the sake of accomplishing the collection of the rites of reality.

original: sum cu drug pa ni sum cu rtsa drug pa'o zhes bya ba ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa'i dka' 'grel lo /üîΩ// / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang du byed pa brjod pa rab tu rtsom ste /
analyzed: sum cu drug pa ni sum cu rtsa drug pa'o zhes bya ba ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa'i dka' 'grel lo / // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang du byed pa brjod pa rab tu rtsom ste /
translated: The thirty-sixth is the thirty-sixth. This is the commentary on the thirty-sixth chapter of the Sri-Cakrasamvara.üîΩNow, from then and so forth, the teaching of subjugation is begun.

original: bzlas pa bsgrub par bya ba'i las kyi rjes yin pas na de nas kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa bsgrub par bya ba'i las kyi rjes yin pas na de nas kyi sgra'o //
translated: The word then is because the rite of subjugation is the next thing to be accomplished after the recitation.

original: @223b gzhan zhes bya ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: @223b gzhan zhes bya ba ni thabs so //
translated: Other is the means.

original: yang dag pa ni so so so sor bye brag tu bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni so so so sor bye brag tu bya'o //
translated: Correctly is individually and distinctly.

original: bshad pa ni yang dag par rab tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni yang dag par rab tu bshad pa'o //
translated: Teaching is the correct explanation.

original: gzugs ni lus te /
analyzed: gzugs ni lus te /
translated: Form is the body.

original: de bzhin gnon pa ni sems can te /
analyzed: de bzhin gnon pa ni sems can te /
translated: Likewise, the subjugated are the sentient beings.

original: de'i sgrub thabs shes pa ni gzugs gnon pa'i sgrub thabs te thabs shes pa'i don to //üîΩde ni / phan tshun bsgril ba'i gsang sngags ni /üîΩmkha' 'gro ma dang gcig tu sbyar //
analyzed: de'i sgrub thabs shes pa ni gzugs gnon pa'i sgrub thabs te thabs shes pa'i don to // de ni / phan tshun bsgril ba'i gsang sngags ni / mkha' 'gro ma dang gcig tu sbyar //
translated: The means of its accomplishment is the means of subduing form, the meaning of the term means.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: That is stated in the line:üîΩThe mantra of mutual embraceüîΩis applied to the dakini alone.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags dang rig pa'i rgyal po dang mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags gsum gcig tu byas pa sman bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags dang rig pa'i rgyal po dang mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags gsum gcig tu byas pa sman bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three, the root mantra, the king of awareness mantras, and the dakini mantra, are made into one.üîΩThe meaning of the line ‚Äúaccomplish the medicine‚Äù is that one should accomplish the medicine.

original: de nyid ni zos na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: de nyid ni zos na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: That is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf one eats it‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: / bzlas pa'i mthar ni skyug par bya //
analyzed: / bzlas pa'i mthar ni skyug par bya //
translated: At the end of the recitation, one should vomit.

original: zhes pa ni zos nas skyugs pa de bkrus la yang de zos na skyug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zos nas skyugs pa de bkrus la yang de zos na skyug par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the line ‚Äúat the end of the recitation, one should vomit‚Äù is that after eating, one should wash the vomit and eat it again.

original: ga pur rjen pa dang bsres nas sngags gsum po nub mo mdun du thun mtshams gsum du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: ga pur rjen pa dang bsres nas sngags gsum po nub mo mdun du thun mtshams gsum du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should recite the three mantras in front of oneself at night during the three periods.

original: de nas bza' ba la sogs pa la btab ste byin na ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bza' ba la sogs pa la btab ste byin na ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one gives it to others by sprinkling it on food and so on, it will be as stated.

original: ba ser skya'i mar ni ser skya'i mar te /
analyzed: ba ser skya'i mar ni ser skya'i mar te /
translated: The ghee of a tawny cow is the ghee of a tawny cow.

original: lan bdun bzlas nas 'thungs nas skyugs par bya'o //
analyzed: lan bdun bzlas nas 'thungs nas skyugs par bya'o //
translated: Having recited [the mantra] seven times, one should drink it and vomit.

original: de bdag nyid kyi gdong la byug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyi gdong la byug par bya'o //
translated: One should anoint one's own face with it.

original: de zhes pa ni byug pa'i rjes su'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni byug pa'i rjes su'o //
translated: The word that [refers to] after anointing.

original: bskus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bskus pa'i yan lag mar de de yis blang ba'o //
analyzed: bskus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bskus pa'i yan lag mar de de yis blang ba'o //
translated: Having anointed, etc. - the limb anointed is taken by that [ghee].

original: ni ni sbyor ba bsdu ba'o //üîΩs'a lu khur ba yang dag ldan //
analyzed: ni ni sbyor ba bsdu ba'o // s'a lu khur ba yang dag ldan //
translated: The word ni is for collecting the compound.üîΩPossessing rice gruel,

original: zhes pa ni s'a lu'i khur ba'i rang bzhin gyi skyong bu byas la mar de yis btsos te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni s'a lu'i khur ba'i rang bzhin gyi skyong bu byas la mar de yis btsos te /
translated: means having made a vessel of the nature of rice gruel, one should cook that ghee in it.

original: de bza' ba nyid du sbyin bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bza' ba nyid du sbyin bar bya'o //
translated: One should give it as food itself.

original: ni ni nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: ni ni nyid kyi don to //
translated: The word ni is for the meaning of only.

original: thams cad nyid du sngags kyi bzlas pa go bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid du sngags kyi bzlas pa go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand the mantra recitation as in all cases.

original: gal te las ni ma btang na //
analyzed: gal te las ni ma btang na //
translated: If the rite is not released,

original: zhes pa ni gal te grol bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩtil nag dag ni zos nas su //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gal te grol bar mi 'gyur ro // til nag dag ni zos nas su //
translated: means if one does not become liberated.üîΩHaving eaten black sesame seeds,

original: ske tsher bcas pa skyugs pa dang // ru rta dang ni bshang lam byung //
analyzed: ske tsher bcas pa skyugs pa dang // ru rta dang ni bshang lam byung //
translated: one should vomit together with asafoetida, and apply [the ghee] to the anus with garlic.

original: lag skyes lto ba'i srin bu dang // zhes pa ni dang ni rab tu sbyor ba bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lag skyes lto ba'i srin bu dang // zhes pa ni dang ni rab tu sbyor ba bsdu ba'o //
translated: The and is for the sake of including the belly-worm.

original: ni ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: ni ni khyad par ro //
translated: The na is for the sake of distinguishing.

original: ti la nag po ske tshe dang lhan cig tu zos nas skyug par bya ba dang / ru rta lan bdun du bshang ba'i lam nas phyir dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ti la nag po ske tshe dang lhan cig tu zos nas skyug par bya ba dang / ru rta lan bdun du bshang ba'i lam nas phyir dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat black sesame seeds together with asafoetida, and then vomit; and one should expel [the sesame seeds] seven times through the anus together with Indian licorice.

original: lag skyes ni sen mo'o //
analyzed: lag skyes ni sen mo'o //
translated: Hand-born means fingernails.

original: lto ba'i srin bu ni lto ba nas phyir byung ba'i 'bu'o //
analyzed: lto ba'i srin bu ni lto ba nas phyir byung ba'i 'bu'o //
translated: Belly-worm means a worm that comes out from the belly.

original: bza' ba ni za bar bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni za bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat the food.

original: byug pa ni lus la'o //
analyzed: byug pa ni lus la'o //
translated: One should smear the body.

original: ba lang gi sha'i sbyin sreg ni khrag gis bskus zhes pa @224a * //
analyzed: ba lang gi sha'i sbyin sreg ni khrag gis bskus zhes pa @224a * //
translated: The sacrifice of cow meat is smeared with blood.

original: ni ; ba lang gi sha'i sbyin sreg ni sbyin sreg gi don du de'i khrag gis bskus pa ste /
analyzed: ni ; ba lang gi sha'i sbyin sreg ni sbyin sreg gi don du de'i khrag gis bskus pa ste /
translated: The sacrifice of cow meat is smeared with its blood for the purpose of sacrifice.

original: phyugs kyi khrag gis bskus pa'i phyugs kyi shas sbyin sreg byas na bsgrub bya lha'i rnam bar shes pa dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyugs kyi khrag gis bskus pa'i phyugs kyi shas sbyin sreg byas na bsgrub bya lha'i rnam bar shes pa dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the sacrifice with the meat of an animal smeared with animal blood, the consciousness of the deity to be accomplished becomes subject to one's control.

original: yang lha ni 'jig rten ba'i lha ste sha ni phyugs nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: yang lha ni 'jig rten ba'i lha ste sha ni phyugs nyid kyi'o //
translated: Moreover, deity means a worldly deity, and meat means that of an animal.

original: de'i phyir de'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúof that.‚Äù

original: mdun zhes pa ni dpal he ru ka thang ka'am lugs sku de'i zhal lam mdun nam rgyab tu'o //
analyzed: mdun zhes pa ni dpal he ru ka thang ka'am lugs sku de'i zhal lam mdun nam rgyab tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn front‚Äù means in front of or behind the face of the glorious Heruka, in a painting or statue.

original: las thams cad pa'i thab khung du'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i thab khung du'o //
translated: In the hearth of the all-action [fire].

original: mtshan bdun gyis ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan bdun gyis ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: In seven nights, one will be successful.

original: zhes pa ni mtshan mo bdun la dus gsum du sbyin sreg byas pas 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan mo bdun la dus gsum du sbyin sreg byas pas 'grub pa'o //
translated: This means that one will be successful by performing the homa three times a day for seven nights.

original: rnyed dka' zhes pa ni dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o //üîΩdam tshig spyod pa'i rnal 'byor mtshon //
analyzed: rnyed dka' zhes pa ni dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o // dam tshig spyod pa'i rnal 'byor mtshon //
translated: ‚ÄúDifficult to obtain‚Äù is the rite of subjugation.üîΩThe yoginƒ´ of conduct in the commitments is the sign.

original: zhes pa ni dam tshig spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dam tshig spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This means that the rite of subjugation is characterized by the conduct in the commitments.

original: skal ba dman pa ni de sngon bsod nams chung ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba dman pa ni de sngon bsod nams chung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf little fortune‚Äù means of little merit previously.

original: bsod nams chung ba'i zhes pa ni da ltar yang bsod nams chung ba'i sgrub pa pos mi 'thob ste nga brnyes pas ni 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsod nams chung ba'i zhes pa ni da ltar yang bsod nams chung ba'i sgrub pa pos mi 'thob ste nga brnyes pas ni 'thob bo //
translated: ‚ÄúOf little merit‚Äù means that the practitioner of little merit does not obtain it now, but obtains it by obtaining me.

original: dbang du bya ba gtso bor byas nas dbang gi las dang bya ba gang yin ba dbang gi las gtso bor sman la sogs pa sbyin sreg gi rnam pa de brjod pa gang yin pa de le'u yang de yin no zhes bya'o //üîΩsum cu bdun pa ni sum cu rtsa bdun pa'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩdpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i dka' 'grel lo /

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i rigs kyi mtshan ma dang mdog dang dri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i rigs kyi mtshan ma dang mdog dang dri la sogs pa'o //
translated: The signs, colors, smells, etc. of the dakinis‚Äô clan.

original: dpa' bo'i yan lag dbye ba ni mdog dang zhal dang / phyag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i yan lag dbye ba ni mdog dang zhal dang / phyag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The hero‚Äôs limbs are the divisions of color, face, hands, etc.

original: de ltar nyid ces pa ni spa bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyid ces pa ni spa bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúindeed‚Äù is to be concealed.

original: brda la sogs pa dang dbang gi yan lag gi dbye ba ni dpa' bo'i dbang phyug rnal 'byor pas mi bri ba dang / brjod par mi bya ba zhes bya ba blta bar bya'o //

translated: The divisions of the signs, etc. and the limbs of initiation are not to be written by the hero‚Äôs lord yogi/nƒ´, and are not to be spoken, as it is said.

original: cung zad gang gis mdun mi gdon //
analyzed: cung zad gang gis mdun mi gdon //
translated: ‚Äú Not to be shown to anyone at all.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni @224b rgyud gzhan la sogs ba la brten pa'i mdun du rgyud 'di bklag par mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni @224b rgyud gzhan la sogs ba la brten pa'i mdun du rgyud 'di bklag par mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that this tantra is not to be read in front of those who rely on other tantras, etc.

original: g-yon pa'i kun spyod legs sbas pa //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i kun spyod legs sbas pa //
translated: ‚Äú The left conduct well concealed.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni g-yon pa'i kun spyod ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rnal 'byor pas legs par spa ba ste brda la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni g-yon pa'i kun spyod ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rnal 'byor pas legs par spa ba ste brda la sogs pa'o //
translated: The left conduct is the signs, etc. of the glorious Cakrasa·πÉvara yogi/nƒ´.

original: gsang ba'i mtshan nyid mkha' 'gro mas //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mtshan nyid mkha' 'gro mas //
translated: ‚Äú The dakinis‚Äô secret characteristics.‚Äù

original: sngags ni bag med pas 'don na //
analyzed: sngags ni bag med pas 'don na //
translated: ‚Äú The mantra is recited carelessly.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni glegs bam du gtogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bag med pas rang gi bya ba la ltos pa med par 'don ba dang / 'bri ba dang / klog pa la nga de la mi blta ba'i dngos grub la sogs pa mi mthong zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni glegs bam du gtogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bag med pas rang gi bya ba la ltos pa med par 'don ba dang / 'bri ba dang / klog pa la nga de la mi blta ba'i dngos grub la sogs pa mi mthong zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: This means that the dakinis who are in the books, and so on, will not see the accomplishments of those who are heedless, who are not concerned with their own duties, and who recite, write, and read without regard for them.

original: /'on kyang gzhan yang gsungs te /
analyzed: /'on kyang gzhan yang gsungs te /
translated: But it is also said:

original: mkha' 'gro ma stong phrag du ma yis bza' ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma stong phrag du ma yis bza' ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe thousands of dakinis will eat him.‚Äù

original: de bza' bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bza' bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that he will be eaten.

original: de'i sgras ni mgo g-yo bar ro //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni mgo g-yo bar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is a deception.

original: ci'i phyir zhes pa la ngan pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes pa la ngan pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Why? He says ‚Äúof bad nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: ngan pa'i bdag nyid ces pa ni rang gi don la aana'i sgra'i rkyen byin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa'i bdag nyid ces pa ni rang gi don la aana'i sgra'i rkyen byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBad nature‚Äù is the affix -an added to the word for ‚Äúself‚Äù with the meaning of ‚Äúone‚Äôs own.‚Äù

original: shin tu ngan pa'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don te bdag nyid khyad par du byas pa'i sems so //
analyzed: shin tu ngan pa'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don te bdag nyid khyad par du byas pa'i sems so //
translated: It means ‚Äúof very bad nature,‚Äù that is, a mind that is distinguished by a self.

original: dam tshig ni sngags dang phyag rgya dang grub mtha'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni sngags dang phyag rgya dang grub mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúVow‚Äù means mantra, seal, and philosophy.

original: bram ze ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bram ze ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The brahmin is the Buddha.

original: sdig pa nyid spyod pas ni sdig spyod do //
analyzed: sdig pa nyid spyod pas ni sdig spyod do //
translated: The one who practices sin is the one who practices sin.

original: de'i phyir gdug pa can gyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdug pa can gyi spyod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the conduct of the wicked,

original: chos dang mi ldan ba'i gnas skabs de ni sdig spyod do //
analyzed: chos dang mi ldan ba'i gnas skabs de ni sdig spyod do //
translated: that state which is not in accord with the Dharma, is the one who practices sin.

original: rmongs pa zhes ba ni shin tu gti mug pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes ba ni shin tu gti mug pa ste /
translated: The one who is deluded is extremely deluded,

original: mngon par 'dod pa la mi sbyor zhing bslus pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa la mi sbyor zhing bslus pa'o //
translated: not applying himself to what is desired, and is deceived.

original: de zhes pa ni gnag klog pa la sogs pa byed pa po de yang bdag gis mi skyob ste ngan pa'i bdag nyid gdug pa can gyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bza' bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la nang du gyur pa'i sgrub pa po'i bya ba ni rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: bgom pa ni shin tu rdo rje bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i gzhung la de lta bu byas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnyed nas des kyang rdo rje thob pa'o // de'i phyir / de bzhin phyogs kyi gos dang mchod //
translated: In the text called ‚Äúthe object,‚Äù having found the yoginƒ´ who does it that way, she also obtains the vajra.üîΩTherefore,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: one should worship the quarter-clad one in the same way.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa med pa'i @230a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa med pa'i @230a * //

analyzed: lam gyi bzhi mdo zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas tha dad par ston to //

analyzed: des ni yang dag reg 'dod spyad //

analyzed: ces pa ni /

analyzed: phyogs bcing gnas pa de bzhin no //

analyzed: de lta de ltar rab tu byed pa tha dad do zhes pa'i don du bshad do //

analyzed: mchod pa legs par sbas pa nyid ni / lha yul lha yi tshogs kyis kyang // ma mthong bar ni mchod par gyis //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: even by the hosts of gods in the celestial realm.

original: yi ge bdun pa'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: yi ge bdun pa'i nus pa ni //

original: snyim pa me tog gis bkang ste //
analyzed: snyim pa me tog gis bkang ste //

translated: and sees them rise up into the sky.

analyzed: snyim ba la sgra'i mo rtogs yod pa ni lung yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir / de nyid du ni snang mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: de nyid du mthong zhing sa la ma lhung na'o //

analyzed: stong phrag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //

original: ci byas nas rab tu ston zhes pa la /
analyzed: ci byas nas rab tu ston zhes pa la /
translated: What is taught?

original: las ni mnyam par brtsam zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: las ni mnyam par brtsam zhes gsungs te /
translated: The rite is begun equally.

original: dgung pa la sogs pa byas nas las kyi chogs rab tu brtsam zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgung pa la sogs pa byas nas las kyi chogs rab tu brtsam zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Having done the worship of the deity, etc., the collection of rites is begun.

original: gang gis zhes pa la yang dag kun sgrub pa /üîΩyi ge bdun pa yang dag ldan //
analyzed: gang gis zhes pa la yang dag kun sgrub pa / yi ge bdun pa yang dag ldan //
translated: By whom?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The seven syllables are perfectly possessed.

original: yang dag par bya brag tu bdag gis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags so //üîΩde dang @233a * //
analyzed: yang dag par bya brag tu bdag gis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags so // de dang @233a * //

original: yang dag par ldan pa yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bsam gtan no //

original: las ni lag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: las ni lag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: aom h'am hr'im hrem hum h'um phat ces pa ni yi ge bdun gyi sngags so //
analyzed: aom h'am hr'im hrem hum h'um phat ces pa ni yi ge bdun gyi sngags so //
translated: O·πÉ ha·πÉ hri·πÉ hre·πÉ hu·πÉ pha·π≠ is the seven-syllable mantra.

original: rnal 'byor ma drug gi yi ge bdun ni rnal 'byor ma drug ste lag pa'i dbus su bkod na bsgrub bya 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug gi yi ge bdun ni rnal 'byor ma drug ste lag pa'i dbus su bkod na bsgrub bya 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes sbyor ro //
translated: The seven syllables of the six yoginƒ´s are the six yoginƒ´s, and when placed in the middle of the hand, the victim is summoned. This is how it is connected.

original: dgod pa brjod pa ni drug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dgod pa brjod pa ni drug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de drug la yang dag par gnas pa'i 'khor lo bya ba'i khyad par ro //

original: de'i phyir ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni khyad par ro //

original: g-yon pa zhes pa ni lag pa'i dbus kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa zhes pa ni lag pa'i dbus kyi khyad par ro //

original: drug tu yang dag par gnas pa'i 'khor lo ji lta ba yin ba de bzhin du 'gugs pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir gang la lag pa ste bstan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: drug tu yang dag par gnas pa'i 'khor lo ji lta ba yin ba de bzhin du 'gugs pa'o // de'i phyir gang la lag pa ste bstan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Just as the wheel abides perfectly in six, so too is the summoning.üîΩTherefore, where the hand is shown is stated.

original: ci byas nas ni lag pa de gang la bstan pa las so //
analyzed: ci byas nas ni lag pa de gang la bstan pa las so //
translated: What is done? From where the hand is shown.

original: gang gis dgug pa'i gzugs 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis dgug pa'i gzugs 'chang ba ste /

original: 'khor lo bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bsam par bya'o //

original: yang ci byas nas zhes pa la /
analyzed: yang ci byas nas zhes pa la /
translated: And what is done?

original: kha nas gsang sngags rgyal po zlo //
analyzed: kha nas gsang sngags rgyal po zlo //

original: zhes gsungs te /üîΩsgra'i gnyis pa'i phyi ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te / sgra'i gnyis pa'i phyi ba'o //

original: rnal 'byor ma drug dang 'brel ba'i yi ge bdun pa khas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug dang 'brel ba'i yi ge bdun pa khas brjod pa ste /
translated: The seven syllables associated with the six yoginis are uttered from the mouth.

original: khyad par du bsgom par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du bsgom par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: ji lta bur gyur pa ni gsang sngags rgyal po zhes ston to //
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa ni gsang sngags rgyal po zhes ston to //

original: skul bar byed pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa dang ldan pas so //

original: 'khor lo rtsibs drug pa g-yon pa'i lag par bsams la /
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs drug pa g-yon pa'i lag par bsams la /
translated: The six-spoked wheel is contemplated in the left hand.

original: de la dbus su aom rtsibs drug la h'am hr'i hem h'um phat ces pa'i yi ge drug dgod par bya'o ;
analyzed: de la dbus su aom rtsibs drug la h'am hr'i hem h'um phat ces pa'i yi ge drug dgod par bya'o ;
translated: And there, in the center, the syllable Om, and on the six spokes, the six syllables Ham, Ham, Hem, Hum, Phat are arranged.

original: / de'i 'od zer gyi dra ba lcags kyu'i rnam pa can gyis bsgrub bya bkug par bsgom zhing /
analyzed: / de'i 'od zer gyi dra ba lcags kyu'i rnam pa can gyis bsgrub bya bkug par bsgom zhing /
translated: The one to be accomplished is drawn in by the net of light rays in the form of hooks emanating from it, and is contemplated as being summoned.

original: de'i lag pa 'khor lo dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: de'i lag pa 'khor lo dang ldan pa la /
translated: His hand, endowed with the wheel,

original: aom hr'i: ha ha hum h'um phat lha sbyin khugs shig ces pa'i bskul tshig dang ldan pas sngags bzlas shing dngos su lag pa bstan na de 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom hr'i: ha ha hum h'um phat lha sbyin khugs shig ces pa'i bskul tshig dang ldan pas sngags bzlas shing dngos su lag pa bstan na de 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: one should repeat the mantra with the incantation ‚ÄúO·πÉ hrƒ´·∏• ha ha hu·πÉ pha·π≠, come here, Devadatta!‚Äù and if one shows one‚Äôs hand in actuality, he will be summoned.

original: tsandan dmar po la sogs pas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sngags kyis lag pa gnyis mnye zhing /
analyzed: tsandan dmar po la sogs pas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sngags kyis lag pa gnyis mnye zhing /
translated: One should rub one‚Äôs two hands with the mantras of the yoginƒ´s, such as red sandalwood, etc.

original: dur khrod kyi me'am /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi me'am /
translated: In a charnel ground fire,

original: gtum po la sogs pa'i me la de kho na nyid bzhin du bskul tshig dang ldan pas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: gtum po la sogs pa'i me la de kho na nyid bzhin du bskul tshig dang ldan pas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: or in a fire of Ca·πá·∏ça, etc., one should perform the burnt offering, just as in reality, with the incantation.

original: cho ga ji lta ba zhes pa ni tsandan dmar @233b po la sogs ba sreg par byed pa la sogs pa ni cho ga'o //
analyzed: cho ga ji lta ba zhes pa ni tsandan dmar @233b po la sogs ba sreg par byed pa la sogs pa ni cho ga'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as in the rite‚Äù means that the rite is the burning of red sandalwood, etc.

original: phul du byung ba'i sbyor ba gang la de yis sbyor ba 'di dpal he ru ka la brten la sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i sbyor ba gang la de yis sbyor ba 'di dpal he ru ka la brten la sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform the burnt offering based on ≈örƒ´ Heruka with that excellent application.

original: de nyid tsandan dmar po la sogs pa bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi rdul dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de nyid tsandan dmar po la sogs pa bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi rdul dang 'brel to //
translated: That very [fire] is connected with the dust of the feet of the victim, such as red sandalwood, etc.

original: dgra yi ming dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: dgra yi ming dang bcas pa ni //
translated: together with the name of the enemy.

original: zhes pa ni bskul tshig dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bskul tshig dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is the exhortation.

original: 'o ma gtsang ma ni ba'i 'o mas slar gso bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'o ma gtsang ma ni ba'i 'o mas slar gso bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: Pure milk is cow's milk. It will be restored, is the idea.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: yi ge bdun pa'i rang bzhin dang / rnal 'byor ma drug po de'i las dgug pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa gang yin pa de yang yin la le'u yang yin pas de de bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge bdun pa'i rang bzhin dang / rnal 'byor ma drug po de'i las dgug pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa gang yin pa de yang yin la le'u yang yin pas de de bzhin no //
translated: The chapter that is also the statement of the rites of summoning and so forth of those six yoginis, who are the nature of the seven-syllable [mantra], is just that.

original: bzhi bcu bzhi ni bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa'o zhes bya ba ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa'i dka' 'grel lo /
analyzed: bzhi bcu bzhi ni bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa'o zhes bya ba ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa'i dka' 'grel lo /
translated: The forty-fourth is the forty-fourth chapter, thus is the commentary on the glorious Wheel of Time's forty-fourth chapter.

original: // / da ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi go cha'i sngags kyi lhag ma yi ge drug gi bdag nyid kyi sngags ni las kyi tshogs kyi le'u ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: // / da ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi go cha'i sngags kyi lhag ma yi ge drug gi bdag nyid kyi sngags ni las kyi tshogs kyi le'u ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, the mantra that is the remainder of the armor mantra of the six yoginis, which has the nature of the six syllables, is the chapter on the collection of rites. Then and so forth is stated.

original: de nas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi go cha'i sngags dang / yi ge bdun pa'i bdag nyid kyi sngags kyi las kyi tshogs bstan pa'i rjes su'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi go cha'i sngags dang / yi ge bdun pa'i bdag nyid kyi sngags kyi las kyi tshogs bstan pa'i rjes su'o //
translated: Then is after the teaching of the ritual actions of the armor mantra of the six yoginis and the mantra of the nature of the seven syllables.

original: las mchog ni yi ge bdun pa'i sngags dang 'brel ba yin no zhes shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: las mchog ni yi ge bdun pa'i sngags dang 'brel ba yin no zhes shes par bya'o ;
translated: The supreme ritual action is to be understood as connected with the mantra of the seven syllables.

original: / aom bam ham yom hrim mom hrem hrim hum h'um phat phat ces pa ni sngags de yis las kyi dngos grub rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: / aom bam ham yom hrim mom hrem hrim hum h'um phat phat ces pa ni sngags de yis las kyi dngos grub rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Om vam ham yom hrim mom hrem hrim hum hum phat phat is the mantra by which the ritual action siddhi is accomplished.

original: tshig tsam gyis bsgrub bya 'grub par yongs su byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis bsgrub bya 'grub par yongs su byed pa ste /
translated: It is the one that causes the accomplishment of the object of ritual action by mere words.

original: de nyid ni ka ra b'i ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid ni ka ra b'i ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That itself is stated by karavira, etc.

original: ka ra b'i ra dmar po'i me tog brgya rtsa brgyad pa'i'o ma 'bab pa ste 'dus byas la sbangs la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ka ra b'i ra dmar po'i me tog brgya rtsa brgyad pa'i'o ma 'bab pa ste 'dus byas la sbangs la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The karavira is the flower of the red karavira, which is soaked in the milk of the one who has the eight hundred menstrual periods, and is enchanted one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas lan re re bzla zhing lingga'i spyi bor bsnun no //
analyzed: de nas lan re re bzla zhing lingga'i spyi bor bsnun no //
translated: Then, one should strike the head of the linga with it, reciting it once each time.

original: de ltar zhag bdun du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhag bdun du bya'o //
translated: In that way, one should do it for seven days.

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag ni lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag ni lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Very well equipoised is the yoga of the deity.

original: de nas zhag ni bcu gcig par //
analyzed: de nas zhag ni bcu gcig par //

original: zhes pa ni nyin zhag bdun gyi rjes su'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyin zhag bdun gyi rjes su'o ;
translated: then means after seven days.

original: / ni ni nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: / ni ni nyid kyi don to //
translated: The word indeed has the meaning of just.

original: ji snyed zhag bcu gcig tu gyur pa de snyed du zhag bzhir ni de yang dag par blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji snyed zhag bcu gcig tu gyur pa de snyed du zhag bzhir ni de yang dag par blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: For as many days as there are eleven, for that many days four should not be taken.

original: 'on kyang de snyed kyi nyin zhag rnams su de la sngags kyang thun mtshams gsum du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de snyed kyi nyin zhag rnams su de la sngags kyang thun mtshams gsum du bzlas par bya'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir ni sgra ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ni sgra ni khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, the word indeed is a distinction.

original: nyi ma bcu gcig par @234a * //
analyzed: nyi ma bcu gcig par @234a * //
translated: On the eleventh day,

original: yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs te /
translated: take it.

analyzed: yang dag par phyin ci ma log bar blta zhing blang ngo //

original: brgyu'o zhes pa thun mong gi las so //
analyzed: brgyu'o zhes pa thun mong gi las so //
translated: The word weave is the common action.

original: brgyu ba'i skud pa yang ka ra b'i ra'i shing gi shun pa'o zhes pa ni gdams ngag go //
analyzed: brgyu ba'i skud pa yang ka ra b'i ra'i shing gi shun pa'o zhes pa ni gdams ngag go //
translated: The weaving thread is also the bark of the karavƒ´ra tree. This is the instruction.

original: khyad par ni me tog dag gis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par ni me tog dag gis zhes gsungs te /
translated: The distinction is stated with with flowers.

original: ni ni nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: ni ni nyid kyi don te /
translated: The word indeed has the meaning of just.

original: de ni me tog go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni me tog go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúflower.‚Äù

original: chu bo chen por ni skam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo chen por ni skam pa med pa'o //
translated: In a great river there is no drying up.

original: ni ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: ni ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúna‚Äù is a collection.

original: por ni de nyid kyi don no //
analyzed: por ni de nyid kyi don no //

original: ni ni nye bar gzung ba ste /

translated: The ‚Äúna‚Äù is a designation.

translated: In some cases, the two should not be connected.
